irena-nrmw-inv-all.def: Municipal solid waste (MSW), often called garbage, is used to produce energy at waste-to-energy plants and at landfills in the United States. MSW contains: Biomass, or biogenic (plant or animal products), materials such as paper, cardboard, food waste, grass clippings, leaves, wood, and leather products. Nonbiomass combustible materials such as plastics and other synthetic materials made from petroleum. Noncombustible materials such as glass and metals.
irena-nrmw-inv-all.name: Non-renewable municipal waste (All)
